alert.note: Alert for District of Columbia (District of Columbia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 23 at 5:35AM EST by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...ICY ROADS POSSIBLE TODAY... An Arctic cold front will pass through the area. The cold front will first pass through the eastern slopes of the Allegheny Highlands by 6 AM, then across eastern West Virginia and central Maryland as well as the Blue Ridge Mountains by 8 AM, and across the Washington/Baltimore Metropolitan areas into southern Maryland between 8 AM and 10 AM. Temperatures will rapidly fall well below freezing within one to two hours after the frontal passage. Wet surfaces from showers ahead of the cold front and perhaps even some snow showers behind the cold front have the potential to rapidly freeze, resulting in icy roads and sidewalks. Be prepared for slippery roads when travelling, any surfaces that appear to be wet may be icy.
